SEARCH
Package com.weather.sdk.client

Class DefaultOpenWeatherApiClient

java.lang.Object
com.weather.sdk.client.DefaultOpenWeatherApiClient
All Implemented Interfaces:
OpenWeatherApiClient
public class DefaultOpenWeatherApiClient extends Object implements OpenWeatherApiClient
Default implementation of the OpenWeatherApiClient interface.

This implementation provides HTTP communication with the OpenWeatherAPI service using Java 17's HttpClient. It handles request construction, response parsing, error handling, and provides thread-safe operations.

Implementation Details:

  • Uses Java 17 HttpClient for HTTP communication
  • Implements connection and read timeout handling
  • Parses JSON responses using Jackson ObjectMapper
  • Maps HTTP status codes to appropriate exceptions
  • Thread-safe and can be called concurrently

Request Configuration

  • HTTP Method: GET
  • Base URL: "https://api.openweathermap.org/data/2.5/weather"
  • Timeout: Configurable (default: 10 seconds connection, 30 seconds read)
  • Headers: Accept: application/json
  • Parameters: q={cityName}, appid={apiKey}, units=metric

Error Handling

  • HTTP 200: Parse JSON to WeatherData
  • HTTP 401: Throw ApiKeyException
  • HTTP 404: Throw CityNotFoundException
  • HTTP 429: Throw RateLimitException (includes Retry-After header)
  • HTTP 5xx: Throw NetworkException
  • Network errors: Throw NetworkException
Since:
1.0.0
See Also:

  • WeatherData

  • Constructor Details

    • DefaultOpenWeatherApiClient

      public DefaultOpenWeatherApiClient(HttpClient httpClient)
      Constructs a new DefaultOpenWeatherApiClient with default timeout settings.

      This constructor uses default timeouts: 10 seconds for connection, 30 seconds for read operations, 3 for max retries, and 500ms for retry delay.

      Parameters:
      httpClient - the HTTP client to use for requests (must not be null)
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if httpClient is null

    • DefaultOpenWeatherApiClient

      public DefaultOpenWeatherApiClient(HttpClient httpClient, int connTimeoutSec, int readTimeoutSec)
      Constructs a new DefaultOpenWeatherApiClient with custom timeout settings.
      Parameters:
      httpClient - the HTTP client to use for requests (must not be null)
      connTimeoutSec - the connection timeout in seconds (must be positive)
      readTimeoutSec - the read timeout in seconds (must be positive)
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if httpClient is null
      IllegalArgumentException - if either timeout is not positive

    • DefaultOpenWeatherApiClient

      public DefaultOpenWeatherApiClient(HttpClient httpClient, int connTimeoutSec, int readTimeoutSec, int maxRetries, long retryDelayMs)
      Constructs a new DefaultOpenWeatherApiClient with custom timeout and retry settings.
      Parameters:
      httpClient - the HTTP client to use for requests (must not be null)
      connTimeoutSec - the connection timeout in seconds (must be positive)
      readTimeoutSec - the read timeout in seconds (must be positive)
      maxRetries - the maximum number of retry attempts (must be non-negative)
      retryDelayMs - the delay between retry attempts in milliseconds (must be positive)
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if httpClient is null
      IllegalArgumentException - if any parameter is invalid

  • Method Details

    • fetchWeather

      public WeatherData fetchWeather(String cityName, String apiKey) throws ApiKeyException, CityNotFoundException, RateLimitException, NetworkException
      Fetches current weather data for the specified city.

      This method makes an HTTP GET request to the OpenWeatherAPI service to retrieve current weather information for the given city. The method handles all aspects of the HTTP communication including request construction, response parsing, and error handling.

      Request Construction

      • URL: "https://api.openweathermap.org/data/2.5/weather"
      • Method: GET
      • Parameters: q={cityName}, appid={apiKey}, units=metric
      • Headers: Accept: application/json
      • Timeout: Uses configured connection and read timeouts

      Response Handling

      • HTTP 200: Parse JSON response to WeatherData
      • HTTP 401: Throw ApiKeyException
      • HTTP 404: Throw CityNotFoundException
      • HTTP 429: Throw RateLimitException
      • HTTP 5xx: Throw NetworkException
      • Network failure: Throw NetworkException

      Retry Logic

      The SDK implements automatic retry logic for network-related failures:

      • Maximum retry attempts configured via SDK configuration
      • Fixed delay between retries configured via SDK configuration
      • Retries on network exceptions (connection failures, timeouts)
      • Retries on server errors (HTTP 5xx responses)
      • No retries on client errors (HTTP 4xx responses) - these are not recoverable via retry
      • No retries on RateLimitException, ApiKeyException, or CityNotFoundException
      • Logs retry attempts at DEBUG level

      Thread Safety

      This method is thread-safe and can be called concurrently by multiple threads.
      Specified by:
      fetchWeather in interface OpenWeatherApiClient
      Parameters:
      cityName - the name of the city to fetch weather for (must not be null or empty)
      apiKey - the OpenWeatherAPI authentication key (must not be null or empty)
      Returns:
      the current weather data for the specified city
      Throws:
      ApiKeyException - if the API key is invalid, missing, or unauthorized
      CityNotFoundException - if the specified city cannot be found
      RateLimitException - if the API rate limit has been exceeded
      NetworkException - if a network error occurs during the request
      IllegalArgumentException - if cityName or apiKey is null or empty
